metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23992 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Thunderbird did not check if the user ID associated with an OpenPGP key has a valid self signature. An attacker may create a crafted version of an OpenPGP key, by either replacing the original user ID, or by adding another user ID. If Thunderbird imports and accepts the crafted key, the Thunderbird user may falsely conclude that the false user ID belongs to the correspondent. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.9.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23992` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
